TITLE: Using ni for basic installation
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using the ni command to install dependencies using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ni

# npm install
# yarn install
# pnpm install
# bun install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing ni package globally
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the ni tool globally using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i -g @antfu/ni
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing specific packages with ni
DESCRIPTION: Examples of installing a specific package (vite) using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ni vite

# npm i vite
# yarn add vite
# pnpm add vite
# bun add vite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running scripts with nr
DESCRIPTION: Examples of running scripts with parameters using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nr dev --port=3000

# npm run dev -- --port=3000
# yarn run dev --port=3000
# pnpm run dev --port=3000
# bun run dev --port=3000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing dev dependencies with ni
DESCRIPTION: Examples of installing a development dependency (@types/node) using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ni @types/node -D

# npm i @types/node -D
# yarn add @types/node -D
# pnpm add -D @types/node
# bun add -d @types/node
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nci

# npm ci
# yarn install --frozen-lockfile
# pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
# bun install --frozen-lockfile

TITLE: Using package manager alias with na

SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_20

na

# npm

# bun

# yarn install --frozen-lockfile (Yarn 1)

# pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
# bun install --frozen-lockfile
```

TITLE: Uninstalling packages with nun
DESCRIPTION: Examples of uninstalling a package (webpack) using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nun webpack

# pnpm remove webpack

SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nu

# npm upgrade

# yarn up (Yarn Berry)
# pnpm update
# bun update
```

TITLE: Installing production dependencies with ni
DESCRIPTION: Examples of installing only production dependencies using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ni -P

# npm i --omit=dev
# yarn install --production
# pnpm i --production
# bun install --production
```

TITLE: Installing packages globally with ni
DESCRIPTION: Examples of globally installing a package (eslint) using the configured global package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ni -g eslint

# npm i -g eslint
# yarn global add eslint (Yarn 1)
# pnpm add -g eslint
# bun add -g eslint

# this uses default agent, regardless your current working directory
```

TITLE: Interactive script selection with nr

LANGUAGE: bash

```

TITLE: Downloading and executing packages with nlx

SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nlx vitest

# npx vitest
# yarn dlx vitest
# pnpm dlx vitest
# bunx vitest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Global flags for ni commands
DESCRIPTION: Examples of global flags available for use with ni commands, including printing command, changing directory, and showing help.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# ?               | Print the command execution depends on the agent
ni vite ?

# -C              | Change directory before running the command
ni -C packages/foo vite
nr -C playground dev

# -v, --version   | Show version number
ni -v

# -h, --help      | Show help
ni -h
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running commands with na
DESCRIPTION: Examples of running a command (run foo) using the detected package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_21

CODE:
```
na run foo

# npm run foo
# yarn run foo
# pnpm run foo
# bun run foo

TITLE: Interactive package uninstallation with nun

LANGUAGE: bash

nun

# interactively select
# the dependency to remove
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Interactive dependency upgrading with nu
DESCRIPTION: Command to interactively select and upgrade dependencies (not available for npm & bun).
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

# yarn upgrade-interactive (Yarn 1)
# yarn up -i (Yarn Berry)
# pnpm update -i
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring ni with ini file
DESCRIPTION: Example of a configuration file for ni to set default and global package managers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
; ~/.nirc

; fallback when no lock found
defaultAgent=npm # default "prompt"

; for global installs
globalAgent=npm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring ni with environment variables
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring ni using environment variables in .bashrc file, including custom config location and default agents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# ~/.bashrc

# custom configuration file path
export NI_CONFIG_FILE="$HOME/.config/ni/nirc"

# environment variables have higher priority than config file if presented
export NI_DEFAULT_AGENT="npm" # default "prompt"
export NI_GLOBAL_AGENT="npm"
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Command to interactively select multiple dependencies to uninstall.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nun -m

# interactive select,
# but with multiple dependencies
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rerunning previous command with nr
DESCRIPTION: Command to rerun the last executed script command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nr -

# rerun the last command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Global package uninstallation with nun
DESCRIPTION: Examples of globally uninstalling a package (silent) using the configured global package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nun -g silent

# npm uninstall -g silent
# yarn global remove silent
# pnpm remove -g silent
# bun remove -g silent
```

TITLE: Setting up shell completion for nr
DESCRIPTION: Command to add bash completion script for the nr command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nr --completion >> ~/.bashrc

# add completion script to your shell (only bash supported for now)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing ni with asdf
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install ni using the asdf version manager via a third-party plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# first add the plugin
asdf plugin add ni https://github.com/CanRau/asdf-ni.git

# then install the latest version
asdf install ni latest

# and make it globally available
asdf global ni latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring ni on Windows with PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting custom configuration file path for ni on Windows using PowerShell environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
# for Windows

# custom configuration file path in PowerShell accessible within the `$profile` path
$Env:NI_CONFIG_FILE = 'C:\to\your\config\location'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resolving PowerShell alias conflicts
DESCRIPTION: Command to remove the built-in PowerShell alias for ni in the current session to allow using this package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
'Remove-Item Alias:ni -Force -ErrorAction Ignore'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Permanently resolving PowerShell alias conflicts
DESCRIPTION: Script to permanently remove the PowerShell alias for ni by adding the removal command to your PowerShell profile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
if (-not (Test-Path $profile)) {
  New-Item -ItemType File -Path (Split-Path $profile) -Force -Name (Split-Path $profile -Leaf)
}

$profileEntry = 'Remove-Item Alias:ni -Force -ErrorAction Ignore'
$profileContent = Get-Content $profile
if ($profileContent -notcontains $profileEntry) {
  ("`n" + $profileEntry) | Out-File $profile -Append -Force -Encoding UTF8
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating aliases for renamed commands
DESCRIPTION: Examples of shell aliases to restore the old nx/nix command names that have been renamed to nlx.
SOURCE: https://github.com/antfu-collective/ni/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
alias nx="nlx"
# or
alias nix="nlx"
```
